verses.verse: Surely he will never be shaken; (Prov. 10:7) The righteous will be in everlasting remembrance.
((Prov. 1:33)) He will not be afraid of evil tidings; His heart is steadfast, trusting in the LORD.
His (Heb. 13:9) heart is established; ((Ps. 27:1; 56:11); Prov. 1:33; 3:24; (Is. 12:2)) He will not be afraid, Until he (Ps. 59:10) sees his desire upon his enemies.
He has dispersed abroad, He has given to the poor; His righteousness endures forever; His horn will be exalted with honor.
The wicked will see it and be grieved; He will gnash his teeth and melt away; The desire of the wicked shall perish.
(The Majesty and Condescension of God) Praise the LORD! (Ps. 135:1) Praise, O servants of the LORD, Praise the name of the LORD!
((Dan. 2:20)) Blessed be the name of the LORD From this time forth and forevermore!
(Is. 59:19; Mal. 1:11) From the rising of the sun to its going down The LORDâ€™s name is to be praised.
